metadata.title: Enterprise Logging and Auditing System Security Plan

system-characteristics.description: This is an example of a system that provides enterprise logging and log auditing capabilities.

information-types.title: System and Network Monitoring
information-types.description: This system maintains historical logging and auditing information for all client devices connected to this system.

status.remarks: This is an example, and is not intended to be implemented as a system

authorization-boundary.description: The description of the authorization boundary would go here.

system-implementation.remarks: This is a partial implementation that addresses the logging server portion of the auditing system.

e00acdcf-911b-437d-a42f-b0b558cc4f03.title: Logging Server
e00acdcf-911b-437d-a42f-b0b558cc4f03.description: Provides a means for hosts to publish logged events to a central server.

795533ab-9427-4abe-820f-0b571bacfe6d.title: Enterprise Logging, Monitoring, and Alerting Policy
795533ab-9427-4abe-820f-0b571bacfe6d.description:
Requires all components to send logs to the enterprise logging solution
— Requires all components synchronize their time with the appropriate enterprise time service, and at what frequency.
— Identifies the events that must be captured
— Identifies who is responsible/accountable for performing these functions

941e2a87-46f4-4b3e-9e87-bbd187091ca1.title: System Integration Process
941e2a87-46f4-4b3e-9e87-bbd187091ca1.description: Ensures proper integration into the enterprise as new systems are brought into production.

links.text: Ensures logs from components in new system are able to published to the logging server. Ensures log monitoring capabilities recognize new system as authorized.

fa39eb84-3014-46b4-b6bc-7da10527c262.title: Inventory Management Process
fa39eb84-3014-46b4-b6bc-7da10527c262.description: Describes how new components are introduced into the system - ensures monitoring teams know about every asset that should be producing logs, thus should be monitored.

links.text: Ensures that all host are known and authorized. Ensures that these hosts publish log events to the logging server.

4938767c-dd8b-4ea4-b74a-fafffd48ac99.title: Configuration Management Guidance
4938767c-dd8b-4ea4-b74a-fafffd48ac99.description: Describes how to configure a component to ensure its logs are transmitted to Splunk in the appropriate format. Also describes how to configure time synchronization.

links.text: Ensures that all host are configured to publish log events to the logging server.
